item.description:

Thanks mates

I had a few doubts about the render but I found a little ghostly look at him… ;)[br][size=1]Posted on: March 25, 2007, 03:00:27 PM[/size][hr]Used some of your advices and edited the background too…

item.title: Once Dead
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:6, topic:71085”]Aren’t you the same people who complained because people gave you bad marks on your first pieces of work?
Why don’t ya give some constructive criticism.[/quote]
i stoped… but legendary loser always gives too good ratings thats why hes cool, sometimes ;).
ok ill be nice since your new to photosho 5/10. Do image > adjusments > gradient maps or image> adjustments > photo filter…

item.title: Once Dead
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“LegendaryLoser, post:4, topic:71085”]7/10

Better

Don’t have the warrior to overlay, dupe the background, put above the warrior, set THAT to overlay, and lower the transparency (just a bit)[/quote]TOo soft!
3/10 no blend what so ever and the bg is yuk… you just overlayed the image, don not do that

Read full topic

I suppose it’s okay, like the text ^_^, 5/10.
